headline: Chicken Piccata II
description: Lemon in both breading and sauce makes an especially flavorful meal.
name: Chicken Piccata II

recipeInstructions.text: In a small bowl, beat the egg together with 1 tablespoon of the lemon juice. Set aside.
In a shallow bowl or dish mix together the flour, garlic powder and paprika. Dip the chicken in the egg/lemon mixture, then in the seasoned flour.
In a large skillet, melt butter/margarine and brown the coated chicken pieces.

Dissolve the bouillon in the boiling water, then add the remaining 2 tablespoons of lemon juice. Pour liquid into skillet. Cover and let simmer for 20 minutes, turning chicken pieces after 10 minutes, until chicken is tender. Garnish as desired and serve.

review.reviewBody: This recipe was awesome. I did however make a few changes based on some of the reviews. I added white wine and used chicken broth (1 cup each). I added lemon zest to the egg batter and capers at the end of cooking. I will make this again and again. Love the very lemony flavor. The chicken was so tender and I'm wondering if the lemon juice may have helped in that regard. Thank you for a great recipe it is added to our rotation.
My daughter loved it and kept asking for more.
I really enjoyed this recipe. I didn’t measure anything just winged it...too lazy!
This was amazing

Ditto, to previous cooks comments. Do not leave chicken in pan while preparing the sauce. Remove chicken from pan and place in a warm oven, while you are cooking the sauce. Add chicken back into the pan for a few minutes once your sauce in thickened with cornstarch.
Amazing and easy --- I have served it to dinner guests and they love it! Always my "go-to" when having someone new to dinner!

I followed the adaptations of a few reviewers summed up by Cristy Basso Short (pounding chicken, lightly coating in flour, warming chicken while preparing sauce, and doubling the sauce.) I used King Arthur Measure for Measure Gluten Free Flour. Came out delicious and will be on my rotation!

Delish. For some unknown reason I didn’t read the reviews first so I had to learn my own mistakes. Firstly: definitely triple the flour mixture. I had to add more midway through and it was a pain because my hands were all goopy. Second: deglaze with a white wine instead of water- this just makes more flavor sense. Third: what about the capers?!?! You can’t have chicken piccata without capers!
as recommended I dipped in flour then egg then flour. was delicious!!! that was the only thing I changed .

I made this to try something different with the chicken breasts I had. This came out fantastic! I will make this again for sure. I did add a few slices of lemon in the pan with the chicken as it was cooking. I think it was just a little too much lemon so I won't try that again. I served this with white rice and we used the juice in the pan on the rice. It was delicious!

Followed recipe exactly. 1st, there wasn't enough flour mixture to coat 4 breasts (had to make more). 2nd, breading turned soggy after adding liquid. 3rd, other than lemon totally flavorless. I cannot understand all the positive reviews sorry.
Good
Turned out great! Everyone loved it! I added capers to the sauce because my husband loves them. Yummy!
I followed the recipe to the tee and it was really bland. Didn't really taste like lemon either. My family was NOT impressed at all. Really disappointed as I LOVE Chicken Piccata

I cheated and bought chicken cutlets because I have zero space to work in. 
A quick dip, dredge, then browned the cutlets nicely. Added the broth with remaining lemon juice, allowed to reduce a bit. 
Versatile, healthy, popular with my family. This recipe is requested more than pizza!

I cheated and bought chicken cutlets because I have zero space to work in. 
A quick dip, dredge, then browned the cutlets nicely. Added the broth with remaining lemon juice, allowed to reduce a bit. 
Versatile, healthy, popular with my family. This recipe is requested more than pizza!

Very tasty! I did makes a few tweaks based on the reviews for this recipe. I used two chicken breast and cut them in half instead of flattening them. I also double dipped the chicken in the flour mix as well (dipped in flour, dipped in egg, dipped in flour again). When the chicken was done cooking I put them in a oven set at 250 to keep them warm while I made the sauce and noodles to go with this meal. For the sauce I used 1/2 cup of chicken broth instead of using the powder. I also added half a tablespoon of cornstarch to thicken the sauce. I put the chicken in the pan with the sauce right before serving so nothing was soggy by the time the food made it to the plate. Husband loved it! Will be making it again
I made no changes and yes I would make it again!
Easy dish but gummy breading.

Dipped chicken in flour, then egg, then the flour mixture, looked good until I added the sauce, the breading started falling off. Going to make again and serve the sauce over pasta with chicken on top.

Honestly, the sauce had the most amazing flavor! I made it exactly as written. If I were to make again, and I’m sure I will, I will season the chicken before doing the egg wash and flour. When eating just the chicken, it was a little bland.
should of listened to some of the previous posts. Was soggy and came off easily, but the chicken itself was good.
This was so easy to make! My family loved the flavors. We'll definitely be making this one again and again!

This was good, but I needed way more flour to cover my chicken. It's a minor gripe, but by the time I realized it, my hands were all covered in chicken juice, egg, and flour, and I already had two in the pan, so it was a little bit of a pain. to drop everything, wash my hands, get the flour, etc. while two chicken breasts were already overbrowning. Just a forewarning, make extra seasoned flour before you start.

I've made a few changes that I think take this dish from great to phenomenal. 

For the chicken itself: 

Replace chicken bouillon powder with equal measurements chicken base

Ditch the egg mixture, and simply season the raw chicken breast with S&P, Garlic Powder & Paprika, then coat the entire thing in flour and pan sear in vegetable oil 

This is the authentic way to make it, and the way that most (if not all) restaurants worth anything will do it.

For the sauce:

Add a 1/4 white onion, a 1/4 Cup of Capers (drained) and 2 T minced garlic to the butter and saute until soft. Then deglaze the pan with 1/2 cup white wine (instead of water). Once the wine reduces a little, add the lemon juice and chicken base (make sure to use actual chicken base, not bouillon powder for the best flavor)

Finally serve the chicken this over Capellini and steamed Asparagus, pouring the sauce over everything. 

Will definitely make again.
This was fairly easy to make and it had great flavor. I would ay that for four large breasts you will probably have to increase the ingredients to coat them properly.

So good ... I’ve made this version twice now, along with another version similar once. I serve this over rice. I made extra sauce so I’d have it for the leftovers. I really liked it. Lemon isn’t overwhelming, but enough you taste it, but not all you taste. I don’t add salt because I use better than bouillon verse powdered flavored chicken. It had enough salt. This is a simple, delicious meal

Holy moly! This is the best chicken piccata recipe I've ever made! Me and my boyfriend were instantly wow'd as soon as we tasted it. Only wish I'd made more!! I did add some starch to the sauce to thicken it up a bit.

The only thing I'm changing the next time I make it is I'm going to make more sauce. There was not enough.
OMG!!!! Delicious and super super easy. Kids loved it. Added some adobo and chicken seasoning to flour and made extra of the mixture. Came out wonderful. Will definitely make again.

This was very good. I made the changes as suggested (dredge in flour first, use butter and olive oil, put in oven and put sauce on before serving) and because I had half and half that I wanted to use I made it a creamy lemon sauce. I mixed two tablespoons of cornstarch and half and half together and mixed it into the sauce and added half and half until I liked the flavor and before it was thinned out too much. It was so delicious the dog ate the leftovers :(
This was so easy and delicious.
This came out quite well. I was unprepared for such a potent lemon flavor but, it was an immediate hit. We served it with sticky rice and cheesy broccoli and the kids loved it.
Yummy, this is a very good dish and easy to make. I used a 1/2 cup of chicken broth instead, and it came out tender and juicy and lemony.
So good and pretty easy. I added capers while it was simmering and served it with some spaghetti; to make extra sauce I added some chicken broth in the skillet.
The only change I made was to cut the recipe in half since it's just my husband and me. It was delicious! This will be one of my regulars. I can't believe it's so low cal and low carbs.

I shouldn't be rating this because i made it with a lot of changes but overall loved the dish.

Changes: Added bread crumbs , garam masala & lemon pepper in the flour mixture.
Things I would further change: I used the quantity suggested for half the amount of chicken breasts. I would use double the fluids (water and lemon juice) because almost all liquid was gone and while it was good to eat on its own, I would have preferred more with the quinoa we ate on the side. Make it three times for 4 chicken breasts. You can add some white wine for the same.

I further garnished with a little lemon zest and chopped cilantro.

With all of the positive feedback I had to try this recipe. Well as much as my family and I are a meat and gravy family, this was a BIG miss with all of us. I followed the recipe to the T and had to triple check the directions when taste testing the gravy before serving....it was simply slow simmered lemon juice. This recipe for us was a waste of time and ingredients. Sorry but we won't make this again.
So easy yet so delicious. Simple ingredients as well - everything needed was in my cupboard!
yummy!

It was great. Had unexpected guest come over and in minutes 
I had and elegant meal which everyone enjoyed. It was simple and quick; with few ingredients, which I had on hand. Loved this recipe.

Absolutely delicious! My husband and I said it tasted like adult KFC in the best way. I used better than chicken bullion and oat flour for a gluten free option. My only complaint was that the nice crispy outside completely melted once we cooked it in the lemon mixture and had to finish it off in the broiler to crisp up. TIP: BRINE YOUR CHICKEN! Seriously even 15 minutes will make it more tender and juicy than you can imagine!
I followed Cristy Basso Short's suggestions and served the chicken with a salad. My family LOVED it! Definitely putting this on our "favorite meals" list.

We all love this dish, I did make a few modifications, I only use 1 tblsp of lemon in the water with the bouillon because we do not like it too lemony, I double the sauce so I use a full stick of butter, 1 full cup of boiling water and a large bouillon. Other than that we love the way it tastes!

This was an excellent recipe. Everyone loved it.
I will definitely make it again soon
OMG!!! AMAZING!!! Everyone asks me to make it for get togethers. If I tell people I made it, they all come over, and I have to make extra for everyone to take home!
Loved this and so easy. I used grilled not breaded / fried. To me the trick is to get just the right amount of lemon.
This was very good, though I've never used an egg dip for Chicken Piccata. I prefer Lemon Chicken Piccata on this site. Thanks Terry, I enjoyed making your recipe.

It's more of a chicken and gravy rather than piccata. I followed the recipe according to "most helpful review" and I did not care for it. I'll stick to the traditional capers and lemon butter with white wine sauce next time.

We liked it except for the fact the chicken lost it's nice crispy coating once it sat in the sauce. I will make this again but cook the chicken through, keeping it warm while the sauce is cooking and then just serving the sauce as a side.

This was REALLY good! Next time season the flour and double dip. Stick in fridge for 30 minutes to retain coating. Double sauce and add capers, maybe lemon zest. Serve over angel hair pasta. Can either fry chicken and make sauce separate for crispy chicken, or follow recipe. Good both ways. Important thing is to have plenty of sauce. Squeeze additional lemon juice on meat before serving. Outstanding
Is is a quick, delicious way to make chicken. I served it with wild rice.
This was a wonderful dish that the family loved. I didn't have to make a single modification. This one is definitely a keeper!

My family really enjoyed this recipe! So quick and easy to make on a busy week night. The only change that I made was due to my gluten and dairy intolerance I used gluten free flour and dairy free butter. I also added a little more chicken bouillon and some salt and pepper. Paired it with fresh green beans with garlic and long grain wild rice for a perfect and quick dinner!

I followed a few suggestions from other posts. I pounded the chicken flat, dredged the chicken in egg and flour then egg/lemon and flour mixture. I doubled the sauce and added 1 cup of white cooking wine. Cooked chicken, then put on pan to keep warm in oven. Added 1/3 of capers and 2 tsp of minced garlic to sauce. Put sauce in pan and added chicken. Sarved with pasta. Soo yummy!
Best chicken dish I have ever made! Made some lemon pepper pasta to go with it and it was to die for!
A family favorite. Very tasty. I add mushrooms to the sauce and mix it with pasta and it's an instant hit.

My family really liked this recipe. A few changes that I made were to add more lemon to the egg mixture and not simmer the chicken in the broth/lemon juice at the end as we wanted a crispy coating. The chicken was moist, juicy, crispy, savory and tangy. Very delicious.

This recipe is a keeper. I however followed others suggestions such as doubling the flour, used one less chicken bouillon, and set them to rest for a bit in the fridge. I sliced two chicken breasts to make four thin slices and pretty much followed the procedure to a T. I used one chicken bouillon added the hot water and to give it a bit of extra taste added 1/2 cup of low sodium broth. To add a bit of color I sprinkled a bit of dry parsley before I put it to simmer. The chicken came out juicy and soft. Served it over thin spaghetti and it was perfect. I had only one lemon so I sprinkled a bit of lemon pepper I had to make up for the missing lemon juice. This was AMAZING will definitely make it again no doubts!
easy to make...delicious!

This was really good. I added a little extra lemon juice to the eggs and to the broth, which I used in lieu of bullion. Added capers at the end and voila! A perfect dinner served with rice and green beans. The only problem I had was the crust pulled away from the meal during the simmering, not a big deal.

So I made mine with turkey breast rather than chicken, I was kinda skeptical about how it would turn out because turkey can over cook so quickly. But it turned out to be the juiciest turkey I have ever eaten in my life. I think the breading helped seal in the moisture.

The sauce on the other hand I wasn't super crazy about, I cooked my sauce separately and waited until serving to pour over the meat just so it wouldn't get soggy. I followed some other reviews advice and added a bit of white wine, garlic, sugar, and cornstarch slurry, it wasn't bad, but it wasn't really to my taste. I got too much of the wine flavour and not enough of the lemon.

Will definitely be using the breading recipe again, but maybe with a different sauce next time.

loved it! A few changes I made was to tenderize the chicken and dip in the flour first, then egg, then flour again. I also made ziti noodles to go with it and boiled them in water with 2 boillion cubes to give them a chicken flavor. I used the left over grease to make a flour n milk gravy to put over the noodles. My mom loved it said thegravytasted like my great grandmas chicken gravy! :-) Great compliment!

This recipe was outstanding. I doubled the sauce based on other reviews and added capers. I also added a little cornstarch to thicken. My only issue was, the chicken stuck to the pan and tore off the yummy coating. Anyone have a remedy for this? Im going to try to spray the pan next time before the butter. I made this with mashed potatoes and broiled asparagus. Next time I'm going to put over linguini. Absoloutely delicious!
simple and delicious
Very easy recipe, added fresh lemon thyme and chives from my garden. Family loved it. Lemon flavor was very subtle and chicken was deliciously juicy.
absolutely delicious. don't change a thing. I also used this method on baked halibut only minus the chicken broth...it was phenomenal both for chicken & halibut!

Just tried this recipe. I used olive oil and butter to brown the chicken. I used low sodium chicken broth instead of bouillon. I also floured the chicken, dipped in egg, then coated with the flour/paprika mixture. I browned the chicken, took it out, covered it, and made the sauce. I doubled the amount after seeing that the 1/2 cup of low sodium chicken broth was not much.(also added mushrooms)
 I used a little wine, and also thickened the sauce with cornstarch. I then returned the chicken to cook about 10 minutes. The chicken did not get soggy. It was very good. A lot of lemon flavor. My picky 25 year old son actually told me it was very good. And believe me, he doesn't dole out compliments easily.
This was excellent and very easy to make. I had some homemade chicken broth that I had in the fridge that I substituted for the bouillon and water and added twice as much. Excellent

Great! I was a bit worried about the sauce because when I taste tested it seemed way too lemony and/or salty. When served on the chicken however, the blend was really tasty. The family loved, even my picky 6 year old nephew.

I wasn't impressed with this recipe at all. The flavor was pretty bland, even adding more seasoning and it just overall did not have the zing it needed and was a little soggy. Will look for another recipe.
I'm not even sure where to begin. I made this recipe and followed it exactly. The breading came right off. Slid right off the chicken in pieces and into the sauce mixture. . What happened?

I liked this, but the 4 1/2 stars is really not for this recipe as written. I tried to implement changes as suggested by reviews...added wine, capers, doubled sauce. I would love to see one recipe with all the additions.

I picked this recipe this evening when I couldn't think of anything to cook for dinner. One of the best recipes I've found for chicken in a long time. I didn't change it up much. I added some parsley to the flour mixture and used chicken "stock" instead of bouillon. I think I will try it over angel hair pasta.
This recipe was delicious. After reading reviews I added pinot grigio white wine instead of water. I also added capers and artichokes...My entire family loved it....

Followed the recipe exactly. Next time we'll cut the chicken into thin strips and make it that way. We used chicken breasts and the parts with the coating were delicious, but most of the chicken missed out on the flavoring of the lemon juice, so we're thinking of making the chicken smaller next time so it absorbs more flavor. Overall, it was an okay dish, but it didn't have really strong flavors (which I've come to expect from recipes on this site). The flavors are more subtle in this one, but still good and yummy. I'll be adding this to our list of meals and most likely tweak it a bit in the future!

This was the first time trying this recipee. Not only was it easy but very delicious. Great flavor, different than what I usually make and perfect flavor of lemon and chicken. The whole family ate it up.
Instead of cooking the chicken breast whole I cut it up to make Chicken Piccata Bites
Easy and tasty. Can also easily adapt with minor changes: more or less lemon or butter depending on oreference.

used white wine and paste chicken stock/water as the liquid. Also added shallots to the sauce. 
I chose to remove the breast while the sauce cooked, then poured the sauce over just before serving. It kept the chicken crispier.
It was delicious! I added a 1 tablespoon less of lemon and it was still phenomenal! I will be making this again!
All my kids love this!
Delicious! Never thought I could make a dish like this, but it came out perfectly. Will make again!
Someone's suggestion to add mushrooms and artichokes was very good.
This was very good, I added some capers and pounded the chicken before cooking.

I tried the original version which I give four stars, then my own where I doubled the sauce and added a half cup white wine. I liked the wine added even better. I will actually triple the sauce next time to add over angel hair pasta.
Nice and easy. I added capers and additional lemon juice but it's not really necessary. Will make again.
Great recipe, easy to make and awesome flavor! My husband asked me to make it part of our weekly rotation and my son said it's the best chicken he's ever had. Def a keeper!
The chicken was cooked well, but we thought it could use a little more seasoning.
Doubled the sauce!!!! Yummmy!! Served over rice!!!

I really enjoyed this recipe. I used a package of Costco chicken breasts, which is 2 larger breasts. I cut them into thirds and poundes a bit. I had to add a bit more flour mixture to make it work, so I would say 1/3 cup would have been better, and I did not flour thickly, but cutting and pounding probably added more surface area. I wish I had doubled the sauce but I was short on lemon, however I think it still turned out quite good, I just like sauce. I will, be making this recipe again soon and see if I can do a bit better with the breading not falling off in some places, as I am sure that was cooks error.
I made this dish before and it was AMAZINGGG!! :D I am about to make my second dish right now' but instead of paprika I use cayenne pepper gives it a bit more spice.
Might be the best meal I've ever made!! I followed the tips in the "most helpful" reviews. They were spot on. I added capers and served this with angel hair pasta. A huge win!!! Thank you!
Simply wonderful. I always double the sauce to put over angel hair pasta I serve with the dish, and also I always add capers. YUM!
LOVE, LOVE, LOVE!!!!
Very good lemony flavor, but not overpowering. Didn't quite get the crispy texture, but will try again and update.

I followed the recipe along with some of the tips given by other people and added 1 tbspn of capers. Loved it!!!
It's a keeper..
I used lime instead of lemon but it still came out good.

this was SO delicious.. i don't care if it's a true "piccata" or not.. what matters is the taste.. that being said.. always using what i have on hand and reading the reviews i made some adjustments.. parmesan cheese for the flour (and a little more than 1/4 c), 3 T margarine, 1 tsp chicken bouillon, and bottled lemon juice for fresh.. poured the sauce over rice.. super flavorful.. ty for the recipe
Delicious! Double the sauce and add some capers.
